{{Notability|Biographies|date=February 2011}} {{Multiple issues|BLP sources = February 2011|npov=February 2011}}
'''Carole Lieberman''' [[Doctor of Medicine|M.D.]] of [[Beverly Hills, California]] was born and raised in [[New York City]]{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}}. Dr. Lieberman received her Medical Degree from Belgium's [[UniversitÃ© catholique de Louvain]] and received her psychiatric residency training at N.Y.U.-Bellevue, where she was Chief Resident{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}}. She also studied in London at Anna Freud's Hampstead Clinic and at the Institute of Psychiatry/Maudsley Hospital. She is a diplomate of the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology, and a member of the clinical faculty at UCLA's Neuropsychiatric Institute{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}}. Dr. Lieberman worked on the research team and closely with Principal Investigator Michael S Goldstein Ph.D<ref>http://www.healthpolicy.ucla.edu/Bio.aspx?staffID=76</ref> on the NIMH funded grant RESEARCH TRAINING IN MENTAL HEALTH EPIDEMIOLOGY which discussed in part how to use the media for public health education.<ref>National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH)</ref> Dr. Lieberman has a Masters Degree in Public Health from the [[University of California, Los Angeles]].<ref>UCLA Alumni Association</ref>
Dr Lieberman is the author of ''Bad Boys: Why We Love Them, How to Live with Them, and When to Leave Them'',<ref>Dutton Publishers; Amazon.com</ref> and more recently ''Bad Girls: Why Men Love Them & How Good Girls Can Learn Their Secrets''.<ref>Cotigo Media; Amazon.com</ref> In 2006 she authored ''Coping With Terrorism: Dreams Interrupted'' published by European Atlantic Publications. ''
==Books & Publications== *Bad Girls: Why Men Love Them & How Good Girls Can Learn Their Secrets Publisher: Cogito Media 2010 ISBN 978-2-923865-12-6 *Coping with Terrorism:Dreams Interrupted Publisher: European Atlantic Publications 2006 ISBN 978-1-905770-02-1 *Bad Boys: Why We Love Them, How to Live with Them & When to Leave Them Publisher: Dutton/Signet 1997 ISBN 0-525-94116-9
